component.name: Doomsday Engine
component.summary: Enhanced source port of Doom, Heretic, and Hexen

description.p: The Doomsday Engine is a portable version of the classic first person shooters DOOM, Heretic, and Hexen. It lets you enjoy the original games using modern technology, including high-resolution OpenGL graphics, 3D models, and dynamic lighting effects.

Data files from the original games are not included; you must acquire a copy of the original games from id Software and/or Raven Software. You may also use free alternatives such as https://freedoom.github.io/.
Patch release that addresses issues found in version 2.3.

ul.li: Incorrect positioning of sky textures in Heretic and Hexen.
Alignment of floor/ceiling textures whose size is not 64×64.

description.p: This version improves support for vanilla DOOM render hacks and adds more script bindings to manipulate things in the map. In Heretic, ambient sound sequences are now customizable.

ul.li: Color adjustments only affect the game view.
Heretic Phoenix Rod effect was too bright.
Targa images with 8-bit colors or run-length encoding.
FPS limiter was only available when a game was loaded.

description.p: Patch release that addresses issues found in version 2.2.

ul.li: Some 3D models are only partially visible.
"cubeshot" console command did not render all sides of the cube.
More consistent HUD 3D weapon model positioning.
